Configure the System Logging Profile

Use this task to create a system (2G and 4G) logging profile for troubleshooting and maintaining the PW EMS.

  1. In the navigation bar, click Profiles > Summary.
  2. In the Profiles window, click the System Profiles tab.
  3. Click +Create.
  4. In the Create System Profile window, enter the name of this profile in the Profile Name field.
  5. Select Logging from the Profile Type.
    NOTE: Use the Name field to search for a specific parameter on this page.
  6. Click LoggingModuleList to specify one or more radio carrier instances for this profile. Click the plus button (+) to add more instances.
  7. Select from the Module Name drop-down list to choose a logging level for each of the fields described below to configure the granularity of information presented in logs:

    Name

    Description
    HEARTBEAT Specifies a log value for the Heartbeat user plane module that detects system health activity.
    RESOURCE Specifies the resource module.
    IPC Specifies the internal inter-process-communication module.
    PROCMGR Specifies the Process Manager module.
    SYSMGR Specifies the System Manager module.
    CFGMGR Specifies a log value for configuration-releated push logs to resmon, which raises the alarm for tasks depending upon parameters that are configured and informs the sysmgr to restart a task if self-healing action is configured.
    SON Specifies the Self-Organizing Network (SON) module logs.
    FAULTMGR Specifies a log value for Fault Manager logs.
    LTERRM Specifies the LTE Radio Resource Management (RRM) module.
    LTECELLMGMT LTE access node (CWS/eNodeB) management module.
    LTEUEMGMT Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) and 3GPP Long Term Evolution (LTE) user equipment (UE) management module.
    WIFIMGR Wi-Fi access point module.
    RTMGR Specifies the Route Manager module.
    DHCP Specifies the DHCP server module.
    S1AP Specifies S1 Application Protocol (S1AP) interface module on an access node (CWS/eNodeB) across all managers in an LTE environment.
    BBPADDR Specifies the B macro pre-processor (BPP) motherboards on radio cards of a CWS node.
    OAMMGR Specifies the Operations, Administration and Maintenance (OAM) Manager module.
    RFLTE Specifies the RF Manager module.
    RESMONFRMK Specifies the resource monitoring framework module.
    RESMONTASK Specifies the resource monitoring task module.
    LTERRMTASK Specifies the LTE Radio Resource Management (RRM) task module.
    LTERAC Specifies the LTE Routing Area Code module.
    RRC Specifies the Radio Resource Control (RRC) protocol connection module.
    CSC Specifies the Country Specific Code (CSC) module.
    UECC Specifies the user equipment (UE) Component Carrier (CC) or UECC module.
    PLATMGR Specifies the Platform Manager module.
    PLATCLIENT Specifies the Platform Client module.
    HWMGR Specifies the Hardware Manager module.
    IPSEC Specifies the IP Security (IPSec) facility module.
    UNIFTPMGR Specifies the FTP Manager module.
    WEBSERVER Specifies the Web server portal module.
    LTESTACKMGR Specifies the LTE stack manager used for UE and the session management.
    LTEMAC Specifies the eNodeB Medium Access Control (MAC) module.
    LTERLC Specifies the LTE Radio Link Control (RLC) address module.
    LTEDCP Specifies the LTE Packet Data Convergence Protocol (PDCP) module
    HNBMGR Specifies the Home NodeB manager module
    LTEMODEM LTE uplink modem used for backhaul module.
    X2AP Specifies the X2 Application protocol module for control plane signaling between two eNBs in E-UTRAN.
    TUCL Specifies the TCP/UDP Convergence Layer module.
    RFMGR Specifies the RF Manager module.
    CERTMGR Specifies the Certificate Manager module.
    AISGMGR Specifies the Antenna Interface Standards Group (AISG) Manager module.
    TRAFFICMON Specifies the Traffic Monitoring module.
    VEPDG Specifies the virtual Evolved Packet Data Gateway (ePDG) module.
    GPSCLIENT Specifies the Global Positioning System (GPS) Client module.
    CLAMPAGENT Specifies the Clamp Agent module.
    ENODEBAPP Specifies the Advanced eNodeB module.
    EGTP

    Specifies the system-wide GPRS Tunneling Protocol v2 (EGTP) Stack-specific and EGTP Application-spe-cific module across all modules.
    CL Specifiies the Cell Loss (CL) module.
    SM Specifies the System Manager (SM) module.
    BINARYLGR Specifies the packet capturing module, which captures and stores packets when monitoring a particular subscriber.
    PORTALREDIR Specifies the Portal Redirection module.
    BWCLIENT Specifies the bandwidth (BW) client module.
    RTWATCHDOGMGR Specifies the Route Watchdog Manager module.
    PHYMGR Specifies the physical (PHY) layer manager module.
  8. Select from the following fields in the Log Level drop-down list based on the severity of event or notification level, which is ordered from highest to lowest:

    Name

    Description
    FATAL Displays fatal events.
    CRITICAL Displays critical events and all events with a higher severity level.
    ERROR drop-down list Displays error events and all events with a higher severity level.
    WARN drop-down list Displays warning events and all events with a higher severity level.
    NOTICE Displays notice events and all events with a higher severity level.
    INFO Displays informational events and all events with a higher severity level.
    DEBUG Displays logging information for debug purposes.
    TRACE Displays all traces and event information of all severity levels.
  9. Click Create+.
Parent topic: Configure Device System Profiles
